description: This core course of Asian studies introduces students to modern Chinese literature and society.
It examines canonical and popular works of Chinese writings including fiction, drama,
autobiography, correspondences, and poetry written in classical and modern styles from the late
19th century to the early 21st century.  Films also serve as supplementary material
when appropriate.  Students read texts in translation and approach them in the context of modern
Chinese society.  They also study the literature as it reflects China's interaction with the West
and the country's struggle to define itself as a modern nation.  Offered annually. Also counts
